doc_info.doc_name: Web-Based To-Do List Application – Requirements Document

doc_content.text: Web-Based To-Do List Application Requirements Document

metadata.orig_text: Web-Based To-Do List Application Requirements Document

doc_content.text: 1. Overview

metadata.orig_text: 1. Overview

doc_content.text: 1.1 Purpose

metadata.orig_text: 1.1 Purpose

doc_content.text: This document outlines the requirements for a web-based To-Do List Application that enables users to efficiently manage and organize their daily tasks from any browser. The goal is to provide a simple, responsive, and user-friendly interface for personal productivity.

metadata.orig_text: This document outlines the requirements for a web-based To-Do List Application that enables users to efficiently manage and organize their daily tasks from any browser. The goal is to provide a simple, responsive, and user-friendly interface for personal productivity.

doc_content.text: 1.2 Scope

metadata.orig_text: 1.2 Scope

doc_content.text: The application will:

metadata.orig_text: The application will:

doc_content.text: Allow users to create, update, organize, and delete tasks via a browser

metadata.orig_text: ● Allow users to create, update, organize, and delete tasks via a browser

doc_content.text: Include essential features like due dates, task categories, reminders, and priorities

metadata.orig_text: ● Include essential features like due dates, task categories, reminders, and priorities

doc_content.text: Be responsive and accessible from both desktop and mobile browsers

metadata.orig_text: ● Be responsive and accessible from both desktop and mobile browsers

doc_content.text: Persist data in a secure backend with account-based access

metadata.orig_text: ● Persist data in a secure backend with account-based access

doc_content.text: 1.3 Intended Audience

metadata.orig_text: 1.3 Intended Audience

doc_content.text: Product Managers

metadata.orig_text: ● Product Managers

doc_content.text: Software Developers

metadata.orig_text: ● Software Developers

doc_content.text: UI/UX Designers

metadata.orig_text: ● UI/UX Designers

doc_content.text: QA Engineers

metadata.orig_text: ● QA Engineers

doc_content.text: Project Stakeholders

metadata.orig_text: ● Project Stakeholders

doc_content.text: 2. Functional Capabilities of the Services:

metadata.orig_text: 2. Functional Capabilities of the Services:

doc_content.text: 2.1 Authorization Service:

metadata.orig_text: 2.1 Authorization Service:

doc_content.text: 2.1.1 POST /register:

metadata.orig_text: 2.1.1 POST /register:

doc_content.text: User registers with email and password.

metadata.orig_text: User registers with email and password.

doc_content.text: 2.1.2 POST /login: User login with correct email and password

metadata.orig_text: 2.1.2 POST /login: User login with correct email and password

doc_content.text: 2.1.3 POST /logout :  User should be able to logout.

metadata.orig_text: 2.1.3 POST /logout :  User should be able to logout.

doc_content.text: 2.1.4 POST /reset: Use should be able to recover the password.

metadata.orig_text: 2.1.4 POST /reset: Use should be able to recover the password.

doc_content.text: 2.2 REST API Endpoints:

metadata.orig_text: 2.2 REST API Endpoints:

doc_content.text: 2.2.1 GET /todos : Retrieves all tasks for the logged-in user. Supports filtering by completion status, Name, and sorting capabilities to help users organize and find their tasks quickly.

metadata.orig_text: 2.2.1 GET /todos : Retrieves all tasks for the logged-in user. Supports filtering by completion status, Name, and sorting capabilities to help users organize and find their tasks quickly.

doc_content.text: 2.2.2 POST /todos: Creates a new task with name, description and completion status. Automatically triggers JIRA ticket creation and sends an email notification to the user with the JIRA ticket link.

metadata.orig_text: 2.2.2 POST /todos: Creates a new task with name, description and completion status. Automatically triggers JIRA ticket creation and sends an email notification to the user with the JIRA ticket link.

doc_content.text: 2.2.3 GET /todos/{id}: Fetches details of a specific task by its ID, including all task properties, subtasks, and metadata.

metadata.orig_text: 2.2.3 GET /todos/{id}: Fetches details of a specific task by its ID, including all task properties, subtasks, and metadata.

doc_content.text: 2.2.4  PUT /todos/{id}: Updates an existing task's properties such as name and  completion status

metadata.orig_text: 2.2.4  PUT /todos/{id}: Updates an existing task's properties such as name and  completion status

doc_content.text: 2.2.5 DELETE /todos/{id}: Permanently deletes a task from the user's account for the given id.

metadata.orig_text: 2.2.5 DELETE /todos/{id}: Permanently deletes a task from the user's account for the given id.

doc_content.text: 2.3 Event Processing Consumers:

metadata.orig_text: 2.3 Event Processing Consumers:

doc_content.text: 2.3.1 CONSUME on todo-items-audit: Processes and persists audit logs for all TODO-related operations, ensuring compliance tracking and maintaining a complete audit trail.

metadata.orig_text: 2.3.1 CONSUME on todo-items-audit: Processes and persists audit logs for all TODO-related operations, ensuring compliance tracking and maintaining a complete audit trail.

doc_content.text: 2.3.2 CONSUME on todo-items-email → PRODUCE on todo-items-audit: Handles email notifications for new tasks. Sends emails to task creators containing direct links to associated JIRA tickets, then logs these notification events for auditing.

metadata.orig_text: 2.3.2 CONSUME on todo-items-email → PRODUCE on todo-items-audit: Handles email notifications for new tasks. Sends emails to task creators containing direct links to associated JIRA tickets, then logs these notification events for auditing.

doc_content.text: 2.3.3 CONSUME on todo-items-jira → PRODUCE on todo-items-audit, todo-items-email:

metadata.orig_text: 2.3.3 CONSUME on todo-items-jira → PRODUCE on todo-items-audit, todo-items-email:

doc_content.text: Manages JIRA integration for new tasks. Creates corresponding JIRA tickets automatically, triggers email notifications with ticket links, and generates audit records for all JIRA operations.

metadata.orig_text: Manages JIRA integration for new tasks. Creates corresponding JIRA tickets automatically, triggers email notifications with ticket links, and generates audit records for all JIRA operations.

doc_content.text: 3. Functional Requirements

metadata.orig_text: 3. Functional Requirements

doc_content.text: 2.1 User Accounts

metadata.orig_text: 2.1 User Accounts

doc_content.text: FR1.1 : Users can register using an email and password.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR1.1 : Users can register using an email and password.

doc_content.text: FR1.2 : Users can log in and log out securely.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR1.2 : Users can log in and log out securely.

doc_content.text: FR1.3 : Password recovery/reset functionality must be available.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR1.3 : Password recovery/reset functionality must be available.

doc_content.text: 2.2 Task Management

metadata.orig_text: 2.2 Task Management

doc_content.text: FR2.1 : Users can create tasks with a name (required) and optional description.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR2.1 : Users can create tasks with a name (required) and optional description.

doc_content.text: → The task name must be between 5 and 250 characters.

metadata.orig_text: → The task name must be between 5 and 250 characters.

doc_content.text: FR2.2 : Users can set due dates and times for tasks.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR2.2 : Users can set due dates and times for tasks.

doc_content.text: FR2.3 : Users can mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR2.3 : Users can mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

doc_content.text: FR2.4 : Users can delete or edit existing tasks.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR2.4 : Users can delete or edit existing tasks.

doc_content.text: FR2.5 : Users can assign priority levels (e.g., Low, Medium, High).

metadata.orig_text: ● FR2.5 : Users can assign priority levels (e.g., Low, Medium, High).

doc_content.text: FR2.6 : Users can create subtasks under main tasks.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR2.6 : Users can create subtasks under main tasks.

doc_content.text: 2.3 Task Organization

metadata.orig_text: 2.3 Task Organization

doc_content.text: FR3.1 : Users can create multiple task lists (e.g., "Work", "Personal").

metadata.orig_text: ● FR3.1 : Users can create multiple task lists (e.g., "Work", "Personal").

doc_content.text: FR3.2 : Users can categorize or tag tasks.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR3.2 : Users can categorize or tag tasks.

doc_content.text: FR3.3 : Users can filter tasks by category, due date, completion status, or priority.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR3.3 : Users can filter tasks by category, due date, completion status, or priority.

doc_content.text: FR3.4 : Users can sort tasks (e.g., by due date, creation date, or priority).

metadata.orig_text: ● FR3.4 : Users can sort tasks (e.g., by due date, creation date, or priority).

doc_content.text: 2.4 Notifications

metadata.orig_text: 2.4 Notifications

doc_content.text: FR4.1 : Users can set optional email reminders for tasks.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR4.1 : Users can set optional email reminders for tasks.

doc_content.text: FR4.2 : Reminders are triggered before task due time (customizable by user).

metadata.orig_text: ● FR4.2 : Reminders are triggered before task due time (customizable by user).

doc_content.text: 2.5 Search

metadata.orig_text: 2.5 Search

doc_content.text: FR5.1 : Users can search for tasks by name or keywords.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR5.1 : Users can search for tasks by name or keywords.

doc_content.text: 2.6 Data Persistence

metadata.orig_text: 2.6 Data Persistence

doc_content.text: FR6.1 : User data is stored in a backend database.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR6.1 : User data is stored in a backend database.

doc_content.text: FR6.2 : Data is tied to individual user accounts and securely retrieved upon login.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR6.2 : Data is tied to individual user accounts and securely retrieved upon login.

doc_content.text: Here are the enhanced requirements, incorporating JIRA ticket creation, email notifications for new TODO list items with JIRA links, and auditing:

metadata.orig_text: Here are the enhanced requirements, incorporating JIRA ticket creation, email notifications for new TODO list items with JIRA links, and auditing:

doc_content.text: 2.7 Integration with JIRA & Notifications

metadata.orig_text: 2.7 Integration with JIRA & Notifications

doc_content.text: FR7.1 : Upon creation of a new TODO list item, a corresponding JIRA ticket must be automatically created.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR7.1 : Upon creation of a new TODO list item, a corresponding JIRA ticket must be automatically created.

doc_content.text: FR7.2 : An email notification must be sent to the task creator upon successful JIRA ticket creation for a new TODO item.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR7.2 : An email notification must be sent to the task creator upon successful JIRA ticket creation for a new TODO item.

doc_content.text: FR7.3 : The email notification must include a direct link to the newly created JIRA ticket.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR7.3 : The email notification must include a direct link to the newly created JIRA ticket.

doc_content.text: FR7.4 : All requests for new TODO list items and their corresponding email notifications must be audited for tracking and compliance purposes.

metadata.orig_text: ● FR7.4 : All requests for new TODO list items and their corresponding email notifications must be audited for tracking and compliance purposes.

doc_content.text: 3. Non-Functional Requirements

metadata.orig_text: 3. Non-Functional Requirements

doc_content.text: 3.1 Usability

metadata.orig_text: 3.1 Usability

doc_content.text: The application must have a clean, responsive UI compatible with all major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).

metadata.orig_text: ● The application must have a clean, responsive UI compatible with all major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).

doc_content.text: It should follow accessibility best practices (WCAG AA compliance preferred).

metadata.orig_text: ● It should follow accessibility best practices (WCAG AA compliance preferred).

doc_content.text: 3.2 Performance

metadata.orig_text: 3.2 Performance

doc_content.text: Web pages should load within 2 seconds on average connections.

metadata.orig_text: ● Web pages should load within 2 seconds on average connections.

doc_content.text: All interactions (add/edit/delete tasks) must respond in under 300ms.

metadata.orig_text: ● All interactions (add/edit/delete tasks) must respond in under 300ms.

doc_content.text: 3.3 Security

metadata.orig_text: 3.3 Security

doc_content.text: Use HTTPS for all traffic.

metadata.orig_text: ● Use HTTPS for all traffic.

doc_content.text: Store passwords using salted hashing (e.g., bcrypt).

metadata.orig_text: ● Store passwords using salted hashing (e.g., bcrypt).

doc_content.text: Authenticate users using secure tokens (e.g., JWT).

metadata.orig_text: ● Authenticate users using secure tokens (e.g., JWT).

doc_content.text: 3.4 Availability

metadata.orig_text: 3.4 Availability

doc_content.text: The system should be available 99.5% of the time, excluding planned maintenance.

metadata.orig_text: ● The system should be available 99.5% of the time, excluding planned maintenance.

doc_content.text: 3.5 Scalability

metadata.orig_text: 3.5 Scalability

doc_content.text: The backend must support scaling to at least 10,000 concurrent users.

metadata.orig_text: ● The backend must support scaling to at least 10,000 concurrent users.

doc_content.text: 4. User Stories

metadata.orig_text: 4. User Stories

doc_content.text: ID

metadata.orig_text: ID

doc_content.text: User Story

metadata.orig_text: User Story

doc_content.text: US1 As a user, I want to register and log in so that I can manage my tasks securely.

metadata.orig_text: US1 As a user, I want to register and log in so that I can manage my tasks securely.

doc_content.text: US2 As a user, I want to create and edit tasks so that I can track my work.

metadata.orig_text: US2 As a user, I want to create and edit tasks so that I can track my work.

doc_content.text: US3 As a user, I want to set reminders so that I don't miss important deadlines.

metadata.orig_text: US3 As a user, I want to set reminders so that I don't miss important deadlines.

doc_content.text: US4 As a user, I want to filter and sort my tasks to quickly find what I need.

metadata.orig_text: US4 As a user, I want to filter and sort my tasks to quickly find what I need.

doc_content.text: US5 As a user, I want to search tasks by keyword to locate specific items quickly.

metadata.orig_text: US5 As a user, I want to search tasks by keyword to locate specific items quickly.

doc_content.text: US6 As a user, I want my data to sync when I reload the browser or log in from another device.

metadata.orig_text: US6 As a user, I want my data to sync when I reload the browser or log in from another device.
